item_title: CALL TO ORDER, ROLL CALL & TRIBAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Annual Report of the Open Space/Conservation OTD Program
subitem_blurb: Report on status of Open Space and Conservation Offers to Dedicate Easements Program for 2023. Discussion item only. (CKC-SF)

subitem_title: Presentation by the Ocean Protection Council
subitem_blurb: Presentation by Ocean Protection Council staff on the Draft State of California Sea Level Rise Guidance Update.

subitem_title: Commissioner Remote Participation
subitem_blurb: Pursuant to Government Code section 11123.2(j), consideration and potential action to allow a Commissioner to participate remotely in the March 2024 and April 2024 Commission meetings due to a need related to a physical disability.

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: University of California Santa Barbara Notice of Impending Development No. UCS-NOID-0004-23 (Ellwood Marine Terminal).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on Notice of Impending Development by the University of California Santa Barbara for the demolition and removal of decommissioned oil infrastructure; tree trimming, removal, and replacement; restorative grading and habitat restoration; and installation of new public trails and access amenities at the 19.2-acre Ellwood Marine Terminal Site located on the University’s North Campus at the University of California Santa Barbara, Santa Barbara County.
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Malibu LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-MAL-21-0048-1-Part A (Wireless Communication Facilities Update).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on the City of Malibu’s request to amend the Implementation Plan portion of its certified LCP to modify definitions, development standards, and permit procedures related to wireless communications facilities. (DC-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: County of Santa Barbara LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-STB-23-0007-1 (Childcare Facilities).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on the County of Santa Barbara’s request to amend the Implementation Plan/Coastal Zoning Ordinance (IP/CZO) portion of its certified LCP to amend sections of the IP/CZO regarding childcare facilities and make other minor corrections and revisions. (DG-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of San Buenaventura LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-SBV-23-0057-1 (Accessory Dwelling Units).
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of San Buenaventura to amend the Implementation Plan portion of its certified LCP to add provisions relating to Accessory Dwelling Units to conform to new state law requirements is de minimis. (WD-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: County of Santa Barbara LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-STB-23-0061-2 (ADU Update).
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the County of Santa Barbara to amend the Implementation Plan/Coastal Zoning Ordinance (IP/CZO) portion of its certified LCP to add provisions relating to Accessory Dwelling Units to conform to new state law requirements is de minimis. (DG-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of San Buenaventura LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-SBV-22-0029-1 (Streamlining Procedures).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on the City of San Buenaventura’s request to amend the Implementation Plan portion of its certified LCP to add a new section to the City’s Zoning Regulations to implement streamlining measures for the permitting process within the coastal zone and to make other minor revisions. (WD-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-4-MAL-21-0071 (Congdon, Malibu)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Jo Drummond, Sabrina Zaretti, Christopher Cunningham, Hak Wong, Georgia Goldfarb, Rosemarie Ihde, and Dorina Schiro from City of Malibu decision granting permit to Jonathan Congdon to construct new 4,838 sq. ft., 24 ft. high, two-story, single-family home with 602 sq. ft. attached garage, 192 sq. ft. detached cabana, hardscape, grading, drainage, and installation of new onsite wastewater treatment system, at 20272 Inland Lane, Malibu, Los Angeles County. (DC-V)
subitem_status: NO SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE—LOCAL APPROVAL UPHELD

item_title: Deputy Director's Report For Los Angeles County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-VEN-23-0044 (Steve and Michelle Meepos, Venice)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Citizens Preserving Venice of City of Los Angeles approval to demolish three structures (two one-story duplexes and one two-story duplex with attached garage), merge two lots into one 7,800 sq. ft. lot, and construct a four-story, 15,016 sq.ft. residential structure with eight condominium units (one unit Very Low Income and two Low Income) with 12 parking spaces, and remove five ornamental trees at 2308 & 2310 Pisani Place, Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (ETP-LB)
subitem_status: SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND, de Novo Hearing CONTINUED

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0119 (Levine, Torrance)
subitem_blurb: Application of  Stuart Levine to demolish the existing two-story, 3,676 sq. ft. SFR, pool and pool house, as well as unpermitted development on bluff face of the property including a concrete staircase, railroad tie pathway, retaining walls, drainage pipes and riprap; construction of new 2-story over basement 13,562  sq.ft. home with attached three car garage; and 5,227 sq.ft restoration of bluff with native coastal bluff scrub species at 425 Paseo de la Playa, Torrance, Los Angeles County. (MR-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Permit No. 5-91-141-A11 (County of Los Angeles Department of Beaches and Harbors and Sea Via Restaurants, Inc., Pacific Palisades)
subitem_blurb: Request by County of Los Angeles Department of Beaches and Harbors and Sea Via Restaurants, Inc. (dba Gladstones) for after-the-fact authorization for continued use of public parking lot and public viewing deck by restaurant from January 13, 2022 to January 13, 2027 at 17300 Pacific Coast Highway, Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (SA-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: Withdrawn

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0380 (Brittingham, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Kathy Brittingham to remove existing 160 sq. ft. floating dock, 490 sq. ft. pier platform, 48 sq. ft. gangway, and six concrete marina piles, as well as relocate one 12” concrete marina pile, and remove and replace one 12' concrete marina pile. Also proposes to construct new 192 sq. ft. floating dock, 396 sq. ft. pier platform, and 72 sq. ft. gangway and install two new 14” “T” piles resulting in decrease of 38 sq. ft. of overwater coverage and 4 sq. ft. of fill at 1400 Bay Front Ave, Newport Beach, Orange County. (ETP-LB)
subitem_status: CONCURRED

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0416 (First Street Partners LLC, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of First Street Partners LLC to remove and replace a 42’ long concrete deck cantilevered 5’ beyond the bulkhead over harbor waters and with a 42’ long concrete cantilevered deck, including a 42-in. high, bird safe railing along the perimeter of the deck at 16861 Edgewater Lane, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)
subitem_status: CONCURRED

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Arcata office at (707) 826-8950.

subitem_title: Permit No. 1-87-233-A1(Melendi, Mendocino Co.)
subitem_blurb: Request by Bob and Julie Melendi to amend previously approved permit for single family home and detached garage to (1) construct 537-sq.ft. max. 22-ft-high guest cottage addition to garage, (2) authorize after-the-fact fencing along property boundaries, and (3) remove unpermitted fencing and other development from and restore areas within public access easement and environmentally sensitive habitats at 45575 S. Caspar Dr., Mendocino, Mendocino County. (TRG-A) (Note: the Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_title: Deputy Director's Report for Orange County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

item_title: Please note: Items 12b [LCP-5-NPB-22-0056-1 (Part B)] and 13a [5-14-1785-A2] will have a combined presentation and hearing.

subitem_title: City of Laguna Beach Local Coastal Program Amendment No. LCP-5-LGB-23-0038-3.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Laguna Beach to modify the Implementation Plan (IP) of the certified LCP to add development standards/regulations and allow for certain one- or two-unit housing developments and urban lot splits to be approved ministerially in single-family residential zones  pursuant to Senate Bill 9. (JP-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach Local Coastal Program Amendment No. LCP-5-NPB-22-0056-1 (Part B).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action regarding City of Newport Beach’s request to amend the Coastal Land Use Plan (CLUP) and the Implementation Plan (IP) of the City’s Certified Local Coastal Program (LCP) to increase the allowable development limit for properties located at 3300 Newport Boulevard (Lido House Hotel) and 475 32nd Street from 103,470 square feet to 118,572 square feet (15,103 square foot increase), remove reference to a fire station, and correct a reference regarding height limits. (FSY-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. 5-14-1785-A2 (Lido House, LLC, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Lido House, LLC for an amendment to increase the site’s maximum allowed gross square footage by 15,103 sq.ft. with the addition of five (5) guest cottages; enclosure of storage space; covered walkway and pre-function, breakout meeting space; greenhouse breakout sitting room and enlargement of three (3) existing guestrooms.  The project also includes revised parking areas, the demolition of an existing non-functioning Fire Station and the creation of fourteen (14) public parking spaces and installation of fencing along portions of the 32nd Street and Newport Boulevard frontages.  Grading will consist of 900 cu. yds. of cut, 200 cu. yds. of fill and 700 cu. yds. of export, located at 3300 Newport Boulevard and 475 32nd Street, Newport Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-NPB-23-0052 (Blues 1905, LLC, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Jim Mosher, Ron Yeo, Dan Herman, and Walt Howard from decision of City of Newport Beach granting permit with conditions to Blues 1905, LLC for the remodel of, and 2,511 sq. ft. addition to, an existing 5-story, 5,781 sq. ft. single-family residence on a 10,360 sq. ft. lot, including 1,400 cy. of cut and no fill, at 2741 Ocean Boulevard, Corona Del Mar, Newport Beach, Orange County. (CS-LB)
subitem_status: SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND, de Novo Hearing CONTINUED

subitem_title: Application No. 5-18-0930 (Graham Property Management, LLC, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application of Graham Property Management, LLC (on remand from judicial settlement) to construct new 3-level, 25-ft. tall above natural grade, 4,527 sq. ft. single-family home, two garages totaling 862 sq. ft., 1,826 sq. ft. terrace/deck areas, grading for construction of semi-subterranean level, 20 caissons for stabilization of the building pad area, radiant heat barrier wall surrounding development, new cul-de-sac/fire truck turnaround with driveway cut-out, install new fire hydrant at cul-de-sac, drainage improvements, new landscaping and restoration of native vegetation on vacant 34,784 sq. ft.  coastal canyon lot at 217 Vista Marina, San Clemente, Orange County. (LR-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0397 (City of San Clemente, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application of the City of San Clemente to construct a replacement sewer lift station in a 7-ft. diameter by 28-ft. deep circular wet well with a valve vault and a meter fault connecting to the existing force main, install a 10-in. diameter overflow pipe to convey sewage flows to the existing lift station’s wet well, replace approximately 217 linear ft. of damaged storm drain within the existing alignment and easement, construct approximately 168 ft. of lateral storm drain pipelines with six catch basins, repair the motor control center and steps leading to the sewer lift station electrical room, replace approximately 1,100 linear ft. of 6-in. sewer force main pipe with new 6-in. PVC pipe, conduct minor maintenance of vehicular access road, and plant 2,071 sq. ft. of native vegetation in its place near Cyprus Shore Community Building west of Avenida De Las Palmera and Calle Ariana intersection, San Clemente, Orange County. (EG-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0602-REC (Gabriel, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Reconsideration of Commission action to grant permit with conditions to Andrew Gabriel for removal of an existing 1,306 sq.ft. dock system and 13 14” square piles for installation of a new, 970 sq.ft. dock system with 6 14” square piles at 941 Via Lido Nord, Newport Beach, Orange County. (CS-LB)
subitem_status: Withdrawn

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of Oceanside LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-OCN-23-0035-1 (Coast Highway Corridor Incentive District).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Oceanside to amend its Land Use Plan to facilitate redevelopment along Coast Highway. (TR-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CAR-22-0052-2 (Zoning Cleanup 2022).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Carlsbad to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan with various text changes and corrections to the municipal code relating to grading permit exemptions, density provisions, building height and setbacks, building separation zones, family home day care requirements, mobile home policies, personal services, employee housing, small wireless facilities, and other code changes.  (CJ-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CAR-22-0053-2 (Housing Element Program Implementation).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Carlsbad to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to add and update various sections regarding objective design standards for affordable multi-family residential projects. (CJ-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Del Mar LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-DMR-23-0031-1 (Public Facilities Rezone). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the request by City of Del Mar to amend its certified Land Use Plan and Implementation Plan to redesignate 7 City-owned sites from residential (6 sites) and commercial (1 site) to public park and public facilities to correct land use and zoning inconsistencies. (SL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of San Diego Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-23-0027-2 (Housing Action Package).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Land Development Code (IP) addressing housing and accessory dwelling units to implement Senate Bill 9. (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Postponed

subitem_title: City of San Diego Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-23-0052-3 (Housing Action Package ADU Amendment).
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Land Development Code (IP) to change the amount of time an accessory dwelling unit must be deed-restricted as very low-income or low-income housing in order to qualify for an additional accessory dwelling unit is de minimis. (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Postponed

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-6-ENC-23-0024 (Encinitas Beacon's Beach Parking Lot, Encinitas)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by John Wigmore, Michael Conway, and Matthew Gordon from decision of City of Encinitas granting permit with conditions to City of Encinitas to remove existing 26-stall public parking lot and blufftop sidewalk and replace with 15 public parking spaces and sidewalk located further inland at 948 Neptune Ave., Encinitas, San Diego County. (JP-SD)
subitem_status: NO SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE—LOCAL APPROVAL UPHELD

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-6-PEN-23-0053 (Misenum LLC, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Keith Behner from decision of City of San Diego granting permit with conditions to Misenum LLC to redevelop 6,380 sq.ft., 2-story single-family home to create 6,115 sq.ft., 2-story single family home with attached 2-car garage and construct detached 796 sq.ft., 2-story accessory dwelling unit with carport, swimming pool, and landscaping on 12,586 sq.ft. lot, and remove private encroachments on adjacent tidelands, at 821 San Antonio Place, San Diego, San Diego County. (ML-SD)
subitem_status: No substantial issue found

subitem_title: Application No. 6-23-0574 (Symphony Asset Pool XVI, LLC, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of Symphony Asset Pool XVI, LLC for interior and exterior remodel of Building 7 at Belmont Park to install new indoor and outdoor bar area at 3146 Mission Blvd, Mission Beach, San Diego, San Diego County. (AL-SD)(Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Permit No. 6-08-038-A3 (Solana Beach Sand Compatibility and Opportunistic Use Program, Solana Beach)
subitem_blurb: Request by City of Solana Beach to amend permit for opportunistic beach fill program to extend existing program 25 years, Solana Beach, San Diego County. (LC-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. A-6-ENC-22-0049 (Encinitas Beach Land Venture I, LLC, Encinitas)
subitem_blurb: Consideration of findings for Commission’s October 12, 2023 action approving, with conditions, demolition of four existing commercial structures totaling 10,681 sq. ft. and parking areas, and construction of a new mixed-use development totaling 193,720 sq. ft. across 11 buildings consisting of 94 apartments (75 market rate and 19 affordable units), 18,261 sq. ft. commercial space, 32-room hotel, 2-level underground parking structure, grading, streetscape and landscaping improvements on a 3.79 acre site, at 1900 and 1950 North Coast Highway 101, Encinitas, San Diego County. (JP-SD)
subitem_status: APPROVED
